_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:

This Executive Summary briefly reviews the major elements of the Risk Management Plan (RMP) for Bushmills Ethanol.  Bushmills Ethanol is primarily a producer of fuel ethanol; co-products include dried distillers grains, wet distillers grains, corn syrup, and corn oil. Bushmills Ethanol is committed to the safety of its employees and the surrounding community. Two chemicals stored on site qualify to be covered by the EPA's RMP rule; anhydrous ammonia and pentane. 

1.ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES AT THE STATIONARY SOURCE 
Bushmills Ethanol is committed to protecting the environment and operating facilities in a manner that promotes the safety of employees and the general public.  The design and construction of the facility has incorporated physical and operational safeguards to prevent accidental releases.  Through the proper design, installation, operation and maintenance of the equipment, and the training of our personnel, Bushmills Ethanol has minimized the hazard to human health and the environment from fires, explosions, or any unplanned sudden or non-sudden release of hazardous materials.  

In the event that a release does occur, the facility's emergency response is described in its emergency action plan.  The emergency action plan includes procedures to coordinate response actions with local emergency response personnel (i.e., law enforcement, fire, and rescue departments, emergency medical services, hospital and government personnel, etc.) as well as any potentially affected neighbors.  In addition, the emergency action plan is used to familiarize local emergency response personnel with the types of material handled and internal emergency response procedures.

2.FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED
The Bushmills Ethanol facility is a corn-based denatured ethanol fuel production plant.  Ethanol is produced through the conversion of corn starch to sugars and then conversion of the s

ugars to ethanol (i.e., grain alcohol) through a continuous fermentation and distillation process. 

Regulated substances stored at the facility include aqueous ammonia, which is used for pH control and as a nutrient in the fermentation process, and denaturant, which is used to denature the ethanol fuel product.

3. ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS 
Bushmills Ethanol has programs in place to address accidental release prevention measures required by EPA, process safety management (PSM) requirements from the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), and notification requirements of EPA's Emergency Response and Community Right-to-Know regulations.  The facility complies with PSM for the management of ethanol, fuel additives, denaturant (natural gasoline), and aqueous ammonia.

Employee Participation
Bushmills Ethanol has developed an employee participation program.  All process safety information, process hazard analysis (PHA) results, recommendations, and action items, incident investigations, compliance audits, operating procedures, emergency response plan, and records of management of change are available to the operating personnel.

Process Hazard Analysis and Process Safety Information
The facility utilizes the What If checklist PHA methodology.  The PHA identified the following potential major hazards: toxic release, fire, explosion, corrosion, overfilling, equipment failure, and loss of cooling, heating, electricity, and instrument air.  The facility utilizes process controls such as vents, relief valves, check valves, manual and automatic shutoffs, interlocks, alarms and procedures, grounding equipment, inhibitor addition, rupture disks, and dikes to prevent or limit releases.  
Bushmills Ethanol keeps a variety of technical documents that are used to help maintain safe operation of the facility.  The facility also maintains technical documents that provide information about the design and con

struction of process equipment.  This information includes materials of construction, design pressure and temperature ratings, electrical rating of equipment, piping and instrument drawings.

Operating Procedures and Training
Bushmills Ethanol maintains written procedures that address all modes of process operations, including normal operations, manual operation, regeneration, and emergency shutdown. The facility has developed and implemented a comprehensive training program for all employees involved in facility operations.  

Contractors
The contractor safety procedures establish minimum guidelines and activities in order to assure that the contractor's employees follow safe work practices and procedures.  The procedure includes a contractor screening process and hazard awareness, safety and emergency procedures training.

Pre-Startup Safety Reviews
Bushmills Ethanol conducts a pre-startup safety review (PSSR) for any new facility or facility modification that requires a change in the process safety information.  The purpose of the PSSR is to ensure that safety features, procedures, personnel, and the equipment are appropriately prepared for startup prior to placing the equipment into service.

Mechanical Integrity
The facility's mechanical integrity program includes written procedures, training, and regular inspections and equipment testing procedures to maintain pressure vessels, piping systems, relief systems, pumps, emergency shutdown systems, and controls in a safe operating condition.  

Management of Change
The facility's management of change (MOC) program reviews all proposed changes to process chemicals, technology, equipment, procedures, materials, and design conditions prior to implementation of the change.  Changes are reviewed to ensure that adequate controls are in place to manage any new hazards, and to verify that existing controls have not been compromised by a process change.  

Incident Investigation
Bushmills Ethanol has proce

dures to promptly investigate any incident that has resulted in, or could reasonably result in, a release of a regulated substance.  The procedure establishes the minimum guidelines and activities of the incident investigation program in order to reduce the likelihood of repetitive occurrences of events which could reasonably lead to catastrophic releases.  Investigations will be undertaken to identify the situation leading to the incident as well as any corrective actions to prevent a similar release in the future.

Compliance Audits
The facility conducts audits of the provisions of RMP to verify that procedures and practices developed under the standard are adequate and are being followed.  The audits include a review of documentation and process safety information, inspection of the physical facilities, and interviews with all levels of plant personnel.

4. ACCIDENT HISTORY
During the previous five years, Bushmills Ethanol has had one spill of anhydrous ammonia from a hose disconnect. The spill affected one on-site employee and had no offsite consequences to public or environmental receptors.

5. EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM
Bushmills Ethanol maintains a written emergency response program in its emergency action plan.  The purpose of the emergency action plan is to protect worker and public safety as well as the environment.  The emergency action plan addresses aspects of emergency response, including proper first-aid and medical treatment for exposures, evacuation plans and accounting for personnel after an evacuation, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public if a release occurs, and post-incident cleanup and decontamination requirements.  In addition, Bushmills Ethanol has procedures that address maintenance, inspection, and testing of emergency response equipment, as well as instructions that address the use of emergency response equipment.  Employees receive training in these procedures as necessary to perform their specific eme

rgency response duties.  We work with the local fire department and emergency responders to ensure the proper execution of our plan.  The emergency response program will be updated when necessary based on modifications made to facility processes. 

Bushmills Ethanol has a written Emergency Plan on site and communicates annually with the
Atwater Fire Department as an awareness exercise. In the event of a release of an RMP covered substance Bushmills Ethanol will notify the Atwater Fire Department, and other emergency response crews as deemed adequate. Contract response services are in place with West Central Environmental Consultants.

6. PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY
The Bushmills Ethanol facility has been designed and constructed to meet existing construction and process safety requirements.  Bushmills Ethanol will continue to evaluate and implement changes as necessary to improve safety at the facility.
